intro: Platylepis dioica, commonly known as the two-flowered flat-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are broadly ovate with a smooth texture and a distinct, sometimes fragrant scent. Platylepis dioica is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
